ARABIC: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We guided him on the Way, whether he is thankful or unthankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We surely showed him the way that he may either be grateful or deny.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Surely We showed him the Right Path, regardless of whether he chooses to be thankful or unthankful (to his Lord).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We showed him the right path whether he would be grateful or ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have indeed shown him the way – whether he is grateful or ingrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We guided him to the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We have shown him the way: he may be thankful or unthankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely We guided him upon the way whether he be thankful or unthankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We have shown him the way, whether he be grateful or disbelieving.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We showed him the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily We! We shewed him the way; then he becometh either thankful or ingrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed We have guided him to the way, be he grateful or ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We showed him the Way: whether he be grateful or ungrateful (rests on his will).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We showed him the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, We have guided him to the path, he is either grateful or ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We guided him to the way, be he appreciative or unappreciative.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:3] Verily We have guided him to the way, We have pointed out to him the path of guidance by sending messengers [to mankind], whether he be grateful, that is to say, [whether he be] a believer, or ungrateful (both [shākiran and kafūran] are circumstantial qualifiers referring to the direct object; in other words, We have pointed out to him in both presupposed states, whether his gratefulness or his unthankfulness; immā is used to list the ‘states’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! We have shown him the way) of faith and disbelief, good and evil, (whether he be grateful) accepting faith (or disbelieving) it is also said this means: We have shown him the way to be either grateful or ungrateful.
